image.altText: Julia Gillard, a red-headed woman in a suit, speaks at microphones during a press conference.

items.synopsis: A major expansion of out-of-school-hours care, including at preschools, is among recommendations released by former prime minister Julia Gillard today.

title.children: Royal commission recommends South Australia expand out-of-school-hours care

image.altText: A smiling middle-aged woman with long, dark hair sits on a rural property, holding a large truffle.

items.synopsis: The owners of a farm near Mount Gambier knew there was no guarantee that they would ever find a truffle in their orchard, but this season has delivered in seasons.

title.children: At $1,500 a kilo, truffles have been found on this orchard for the first time, thrilling the hobby farm's new owners

image.altText: An ambulance driving past the Royal Adelaide Hospital

items.synopsis: From patients left in the dark to a serious bungle that impacted the ability of dozens of children to hear, a tough week has put South Australia's health system back under the microscope.

title.children: 'A tragic mistake on top of incompetence': How a serious blunder renewed pressure to fix SA's troubled health system

image.altText: A Central Coast Mariners A-League Men player holds up the championship trophy with his teammates behind him.

items.synopsis: Adelaide United and the Central Coast Mariners may be A-League rivals, but they have one thing in common.Â In a league where teams struggle to break even, the prospect of multi-million-dollar transfers can make an enormous difference.

title.children: 'Our main revenue stream': A-League rivals breaking the mould in the business of soccer

image.altText: Two woman are shown from behind walking into the Department of Education building.

items.synopsis: For decades, Victoria's education department shuffled paedophile teachers to new schools where they abused more schoolchildren. As the historical scale of the scourge in the Victorian public system becomes clearer, there are calls for the state to confront the issue with a broader inquiry.Â

title.children: A psychologist said it would be 'bloody stupid' to send Vincent Reynolds back into classrooms. The Victorian education department did it anyway

image.altText: A man in grey shirt and blue shorts wades through shallow water carrying a red esky on his shoulder, two boats behind him

items.synopsis: For months, the bodies of young migrants have been washing up on the beaches of Tunisia's Mediterranean coast. They are amongÂ thousands of sub-Saharan Africans fleeing extreme poverty and war, taking desperate journeys to escape.

title.children: Every morning, Bilal goes fishing in the Mediterranean. Almost every day, he finds human remains

image.altText: pa Chantelle Anderson and gigi

items.synopsis: As Australia tries to control the risk ofÂ rabies from the importation ofÂ cats and dogs, these pet owners say the country's strict policy has cost them time, money and in one case, their dog's health.

title.children: Chantelle's dog Gigi spent six months in quarantine. She says Gigi 'will never recover' physically from the ordeal

image.altText: A woman looks at the camera.

items.synopsis: The proposed move would see those who commit the most horrific types of murder die in prison, in the wake of the conviction of killer nurse Lucy Letby.Â

title.children: UK plans to impose mandatory whole-life orders on extreme murderers

image.altText: A military fighter pilot in uniform poses for a photo holding his helmet.

items.synopsis: President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says one of the three men killed when two L-39 combat training aircraft collided was Major Andriy Pilshchykov, who won fame in dog fights over Kyiv during the early days of the war.Â

title.children: Mid-air training crash kills Ukrainian pilot who had fought Russians in dog fights over Kyiv

image.altText: Two Port Adelaide AFL players embrace as they celebrate a win.

items.synopsis: Port Adelaide faces Richmond on home turf, before Sydney meets Melbourne. Later, GWS can secure a finals berth with a win or draw against Carlton. Follow our live AFL ScoreCentre for all the scores, stats and results.

image.altText: Baby singing with parent

image.altText: Army cadets in full camouflage, holding guns during a demonstration in front of an audience in a field.

items.synopsis: The federal opposition says an allegation students could not wear uniforms on Friday is "coercive" and "overtly political".

title.children: ADF Academy cadets claim they were pressured to remove uniforms for Wear It Purple Day

image.altText: A composite of Dmitry Utkin, Vladimir Putin and Yevgeny Prigozhin

items.synopsis: Whether the apparent downing of a Wagner plane stacked with Putin's enemies was an accident or an assassination, Russia's president reaps the rewards. This is what we know about the crash that changed everything.

items.synopsis: The number of charities revealing their donors have had personal information leaked to the dark web is growing, as the tally of Australians implicated exceeds 50,000.

image.altText: Nina Kennedy and Katie Moon look at medals

title.children: Pole vault champion hits out after being called 'pathetic' after sharing gold

image.altText: Woman poses in front of hundreds of barbie dolls

image.altText: A person shopping at Australian grocery store, with a basket full of sparkling water, fruits and vegetables.

items.synopsis: Everything we consume contains energy our bodies use to move, grow and maintain health. To work out how much energy is in different foods and drinks, we need to first look at a few core concepts.

image.altText: An Australian male pole vaulter stands holding the national flag behind him at the Budapest World Championships.

title.children: Ricciardo facing possible surgery on broken wrist, Verstappen on pole chasing F1 record

image.altText: Two rainbow lorikeets on a post.

image.altText: A white woman with blonde hair and glasses smiles as she speaks to an indigenous woman

image.altText: Malka Leifer leans against a car on a street in Israel talking to two men
